## ğŸ“ Part 2: SEO Rules for Blog Posts

### Pre-Writing Checklist

- [ ] **Keyword Research Complete** â€” Identify primary keyword + 3-5 secondary keywords
- [ ] **Search Intent Identified** â€” Informational, transactional, or navigational?
- [ ] **Competitor Analysis Done** â€” Review top 5 ranking articles for the keyword
- [ ] **Content Gap Found** â€” What can you add that others haven't?

### On-Page SEO Rules

#### 1. Title Tag (H1)
- **Include primary keyword** within first 60 characters
- **Make it compelling** â€” use numbers, power words, or questions
- **Front-load keywords** when possible
- âœ… Good: "7 Event Photo Booth Ideas That Boost Brand Engagement"
- âŒ Bad: "Some Ideas for Your Event That Might Help"

#### 2. Meta Description
- **150-160 characters max** (gets truncated after)
- **Include primary keyword naturally**
- **Include a call-to-action** (Learn how, Discover, Find out)
- **Accurately summarize the content**

#### 3. URL Structure
- **Short and descriptive** (3-5 words ideal)
- **Include primary keyword**
- **Use hyphens, not underscores**
- **All lowercase**
- âœ… `brandfiltr.com/blog/event-photo-booth-ideas`
- âŒ `brandfiltr.com/blog/7_Amazing_Ideas_for_Photo_Booths_at_Events_2026`

#### 4. Headings (H2, H3, H4)
- **Use H2 for main sections**, H3 for subsections
- **Include secondary keywords** in headings naturally
- **Make them descriptive** â€” readers should understand content from headings alone
- **Use question-based headers** when targeting featured snippets

#### 5. Content Structure
- **First paragraph hook** â€” Grab attention immediately
- **Primary keyword in first 100 words**
- **Short paragraphs** â€” 2-4 sentences max
- **Bullet points and numbered lists** for scanability
- **Images every 300-500 words** to break up text
- **Minimum 1,500 words** for pillar content (800+ for standard posts)

#### 6. Internal Linking
- **Link to 3-5 related internal pages** per post
- **Use descriptive anchor text** (not "click here")
- **Link to high-priority pages** you want to rank
- **Create topic clusters** â€” pillar pages linking to related content

#### 7. External Linking
- **Link to 2-3 authoritative external sources** per post
- **Cite statistics and research** with links
- **Open external links in new tabs**
- **Avoid linking to competitors** unless comparing

#### 8. Image Optimization
- **Descriptive file names** (`branded-photo-overlay-example.jpg` not `IMG_4523.jpg`)
- **Alt text with keywords** (but describe the image accurately)
- **Compress images** â€” aim for under 200KB each
- **Use WebP format** when possible

#### 9. Technical Checklist
- [ ] Mobile-friendly layout
- [ ] Page loads under 3 seconds
- [ ] Schema markup added (Article, FAQ, HowTo when applicable)
- [ ] Open Graph tags for social sharing
- [ ] Canonical URL set

---

## ğŸ¤– Part 3: GEO (Generative Engine Optimization) Rules

GEO = Optimizing content for AI search engines like ChatGPT, Perplexity, Google AI Overviews, and Claude.

### Why GEO Matters

- **ChatGPT has 400M+ weekly users** â€” they're asking questions AI answers
- **Google AI Overviews appear on 13%+ of all searches** â€” and growing
- **AI doesn't rank pages** â€” it cites authoritative sources
- **Your content shapes AI responses** â€” or your competitors' content does

### GEO Content Rules

#### 1. Answer Questions Directly
- **Lead with the answer** â€” don't bury it under fluff
- **Use question-based headers** that match how people ask AI
- **Provide concise, quotable statements** AI can pull verbatim

#### 2. Structure for AI Consumption
- **Use clear hierarchical headings** (H1 â†’ H2 â†’ H3)
- **Short paragraphs** (2-3 sentences ideal for AI parsing)
- **Bullet points and numbered lists** â€” AI loves structured data
- **TL;DR summaries** at the beginning or end
- **FAQ sections** at the bottom of every post

#### 3. Demonstrate E-E-A-T (Experience, Expertise, Authority, Trust)
- **Share firsthand experience** â€” "In our experience working with 500+ events..."
- **Cite specific data and statistics** with sources
- **Include author bios** with credentials
- **Add testimonials and case studies**
- **Update content regularly** (add "Last updated: [date]")

#### 4. Build Entity Association
- **Mention Brand Filtr alongside competitors** in industry context
- **Associate with relevant topics** (event technology, branded photos, event marketing)
- **Use consistent terminology** so AI understands what you do
- **Get mentioned on other sites** â€” co-citations matter

#### 5. Make Content AI-Crawlable
- **Use server-side rendering** (SSR) when possible
- **Ensure clean HTML structure**
- **Don't hide content behind JavaScript** that bots can't read
- **Allow AI crawlers** in robots.txt (GPTBot, ClaudeBot, etc.)

#### 6. Optimize for Conversational Queries
Traditional SEO: "event photo booth ideas"
GEO also targets: "what kind of photo experience should I have at my corporate event?"

- **Think in questions, not just keywords**
- **Target long-tail conversational phrases**
- **Answer the "why" and "how" not just "what"**

### GEO Content Checklist

- [ ] Does the content directly answer the primary question in the first 2-3 sentences?
- [ ] Is the structure clear with logical H2/H3 hierarchy?
- [ ] Are there bullet points or lists AI can easily parse?
- [ ] Are statistics cited with authoritative sources?
- [ ] Is there a FAQ section addressing related questions?
- [ ] Does the content mention Brand Filtr in context of relevant industry terms?
- [ ] Is author expertise/experience demonstrated?
- [ ] Is the content updated recently (within 6 months)?

---

## ğŸ“Š Part 4: Content Calendar Framework

### Posting Frequency Recommendation
- **Minimum**: 2 posts per month
- **Ideal**: 1 post per week
- **Aggressive**: 2-3 posts per week

### Content Mix (Monthly)
- **Pillar Content**: 1/month, 2,000-3,000 words â€” SEO authority, comprehensive guides
- **Standard Blog**: 2-3/month, 1,000-1,500 words â€” Keyword targeting, education
- **News/Trends**: 1-2/month, 600-800 words â€” Freshness, timeliness
- **Case Study**: 1/month, 800-1,200 words â€” Social proof, conversions

### Seasonal Content Ideas
- **Q1**: New year event planning, trade show season prep
- **Q2**: Wedding season, outdoor events, conferences
- **Q3**: Back-to-school events, fall festivals
- **Q4**: Holiday parties, year-end corporate events, planning for next year

---

## âœ… Part 5: Quick Reference Checklist

### Before Publishing Every Post

**SEO Essentials**
- [ ] Title includes primary keyword (under 60 characters)
- [ ] Meta description written (150-160 characters with CTA)
- [ ] URL is short, lowercase, hyphenated
- [ ] Primary keyword in first 100 words
- [ ] 3+ internal links added
- [ ] 2+ external links to authoritative sources
- [ ] All images have alt text and are compressed
- [ ] Mobile preview looks good

**GEO Essentials**
- [ ] Main question answered in first paragraph
- [ ] Clear H2/H3 structure
- [ ] Bullet points or numbered lists included
- [ ] Statistics cited with sources
- [ ] FAQ section added (3-5 questions)
- [ ] Author bio with credentials
- [ ] "Last updated" date visible

**Quality Check**
- [ ] Proofread for grammar/spelling
- [ ] Readability score checked (aim for Grade 8 or lower)
- [ ] No fluff â€” every sentence adds value
- [ ] Clear CTA at the end
- [ ] Related posts linked

---

## ğŸ”§ Tools & Resources

### Keyword Research
- **Ubersuggest** (free tier available)
- **Google Keyword Planner** (free with Google Ads account)
- **AnswerThePublic** (question-based queries)
- **Semrush** (paid, comprehensive)

### SEO Analysis
- **Google Search Console** (free, essential)
- **Yoast SEO** or **RankMath** (WordPress plugins)
- **Screaming Frog** (technical audits)

### GEO Monitoring
- **Semrush AI Visibility Toolkit** (track brand mentions in AI)
- **Manual testing** â€” ask ChatGPT, Perplexity about your topics weekly

### Content Quality
- **Hemingway Editor** (readability)
- **Grammarly** (grammar/spelling)
- **Canva** (images and graphics)

---

## ğŸ“ˆ Success Metrics to Track

- **Organic traffic**: â†‘ 10% month-over-month (Weekly)
- **Keyword rankings (top 10)**: â†‘ 5 new keywords/month (Weekly)
- **Time on page**: > 2 minutes (Monthly)
- **Bounce rate**: < 60% (Monthly)
- **Backlinks earned**: â†‘ 2-3/month (Monthly)
- **AI citations (GEO)**: Track brand mentions (Monthly)

---

*This document should be reviewed and updated quarterly as SEO/GEO best practices evolve.*

**Next Review**: May 2026
